Assistant Manager, Human Resources Job at Electronic Payplus Limited




        
    

        
        Electronic Payplus Limited is a smartcard manufacturing company committed to delivering innovative solutions and exceptional service to our customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Manager, Human Resources

Job Location: Ibeju Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
As the Assistant Manager, Human Resources, you will:
     

            
    




	Recruitment & Selection: Assist in the full recruitment cycle, including sourcing candidates, conducting initial screening, and coordinating interviews.
	Onboarding: Develop and implement effective onboarding programs for new hires.
	Employee Relations: Handle employee inquiries, address concerns, and assist in resolving employee relations issues.
	Training & Development: Support the development and implementation of training programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge.
	Performance Management: Assist in the performance review process, including data analysis and reporting.
	HR Administration: Maintain employee records, ensure compliance with labour laws and regulations, and assist with HR-related projects.
	Employee Engagement: Contribute to initiatives that foster a positive and engaging work environment.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in human resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in human resources.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labour laws and regulations.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
	A proactive and results-oriented approach with a strong work ethic.
	Proven ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
	Professional certifications such as CIPM, CIPD, SHRM or equivalent is compulsory to have.


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a compelling cover letter to: recruitment@epayplusng.com using “Assistant Manager, Human Resources”  as the subject of the email.

Note: Interested candidates around Ibeju-Lekki and environs are encouraged to apply.

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Kaduna South, Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Quality Control Officer ensures that all poultry products and processes at natnudO Foods Abbatior , Kaduna, comply with established food safety, quality, and regulatory standards.
	The role is responsible for monitoring production, conducting tests, enforcing compliance with SOPs, and maintaining product integrity from chicken productionto finished goods.


Key Responsibilities
Quality Assurance &amp; Compliance:


	Monitor and ensure compliance with national and international food safety regulations (NAFDAC, SON, HACCP, ISO 22000, GMP).
	Enforce Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) across all production stages.
	Conduct routine inspections of production lines, cold rooms, and packaging units to ensure compliance with hygiene and quality standards.


Testing &amp; Monitoring


	Perform microbial and chemical tests on raw materials, water, and finished chicken products.
	Monitor critical control points (CCPs) and document corrective actions when deviations occur.
	Verify that products meet weight, temperature, and packaging requirements.


Documentation &amp; Reporting


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date quality records, inspection logs, and deviation reports.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly quality reports for management review.
	Track and report non-conformances, recommending improvements where necessary.


Process Improvement &amp; Training


	Collaborate with production and maintenance teams to improve quality processes.
	Support the implementation of continuous improvement initiatives in quality systems.
	Train staff on Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), hygiene standards, and food safety awareness.


Customer &amp; Regulatory Audits:


	Assist in preparing for external audits (regulatory bodies, customers, and certifications).
	Provide necessary documentation and act as a liaison during inspections.

	Accuracy and timeliness of quality reports.

	Knowledge of HACCP, ISO 22000, GMP, and regulatory compliance in food production.
	Familiarity with microbial testing, laboratory procedures, and food safety monitoring tools.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Attention to detail and ability to spot deviations quickly.
	Good communication and report-writing skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and in a cold-room environment.
	Proficiency in MS Office and quality management systems.


Method of Application

Our products offer great value for money while strictly following global best practices for food processing.
     

            
    



We maintain a high level of organizational excellence in all aspects of our business, from production to distribution, until the products get to our esteemed consumers. Every product is carefully processed and packaged according to the highest global health standards. All our products are NAFDAC and SON certified. natnudO Foods is growing to provide a diverse range of protein products for all our customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Location: Kaduna South, Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Quality Control Officer ensures that all poultry products and processes at natnudO Foods Abbatior , Kaduna, comply with established food safety, quality, and regulatory standards.
	The role is responsible for monitoring production, conducting tests, enforcing compliance with SOPs, and maintaining product integrity from chicken productionto finished goods.


Key Responsibilities
Quality Assurance & Compliance:


	Monitor and ensure compliance with national and international food safety regulations (NAFDAC, SON, HACCP, ISO 22000, GMP).
	Enforce Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) across all production stages.
	Conduct routine inspections of production lines, cold rooms, and packaging units to ensure compliance with hygiene and quality standards.


Testing & Monitoring


	Perform microbial and chemical tests on raw materials, water, and finished chicken products.
	Monitor critical control points (CCPs) and document corrective actions when deviations occur.
	Verify that products meet weight, temperature, and packaging requirements.


Documentation & Reporting


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date quality records, inspection logs, and deviation reports.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly quality reports for management review.
	Track and report non-conformances, recommending improvements where necessary.


Process Improvement & Training


	Collaborate with production and maintenance teams to improve quality processes.
	Support the implementation of continuous improvement initiatives in quality systems.
	Train staff on Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), hygiene standards, and food safety awareness.


Customer & Regulatory Audits:


	Assist in preparing for external audits (regulatory bodies, customers, and certifications).
	Provide necessary documentation and act as a liaison during inspections.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Compliance rate with HACCP and food safety standards.
	Number of non-conformance cases reported and resolved.
	Accuracy and timeliness of quality reports.
	Customer complaints related to product quality.
	Staff adherence to GMP and hygiene practices.


Qualifications & Experience


	B.Sc / HND in Food Science, Microbiology, Biochemistry, Animal Science, or related field.
	4–6years of experience in Quality Control / Quality Assurance in a food processing, poultry, or FMCG environment.
	Knowledge of HACCP, ISO 22000, GMP, and regulatory compliance in food production.
	Familiarity with microbial testing, laboratory procedures, and food safety monitoring tools.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Attention to detail and ability to spot deviations quickly.
	Good communication and report-writing skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and in a cold-room environment.
	Proficiency in MS Office and quality management systems.
